1. Gstaad: This picturesque village in the Bernese Oberland has plenty of scenic snowshoeing trails through the surrounding mountain landscapes.

2. Grindelwald: Nestled in the heart of the Jungfrau Region, Grindelwald offers a range of snowshoeing trails, from easy strolls to more challenging routes.

3. Engelberg: This traditional Alpine village near Lucerne is a great base for snowshoeing, with plenty of trails in the surrounding mountains.

4. Verbier: This famous ski resort in the Valais region is also popular for snowshoeing, with trails through pine forests and along high mountain ridges.

5. Arosa: This charming town in the Graubünden region offers a variety of snowshoeing trails, including a route to the top of Weisshorn with stunning views over the surrounding peaks.

6. Davos: This popular ski resort also has plenty of snowshoeing trails, with some routes offering views of the nearby frozen lakes.

7. Zermatt: This iconic mountain town nestled at the foot of the Matterhorn has a range of snowshoeing trails through the surrounding Alpine landscapes.
